intro.title: Verification Type Explanation
intro.description: PRD 2.5 Requirement: Verification is divided into two categories. Please choose the appropriate verification method according to your needs.

orderLayer.title: Order Layer Verification
orderLayer.scope: checkout_completed Event Verification & Pixel Receipt Verification

v1Warning.title: v1.0 Verification Scope (Important)
v1Warning.subtitle: v1.0 only supports checkout/purchase funnel event verification
v1Warning.supportedContent: checkout_started, checkout_completed, checkout_contact_info_submitted, checkout_shipping_info_submitted, payment_info_submitted, product_added_to_cart, product_viewed, page_viewed, and other Web Pixels standard checkout funnel events
v1Warning.unsupportedContent: Refund, Order Cancel, Order Edit, Subscription orders, etc. are NOT verifiable in v1.0
v1Warning.noteContent: Web Pixels only cover the checkout funnel. Order layer events (refund/cancel) require order webhooks for verification.
v1Warning.reasonContent: Web Pixel Extension runs in a strict sandbox environment and can only subscribe to Shopify standard checkout funnel events. Refund, cancel, edit, subscription events require order webhooks or backend reconciliation, which will be implemented in v1.1+ via order webhooks (with strict PII minimization).
v1Warning.attentionContent: The v1.0 verification scope matches the Web Pixel Extension capabilities, adhering to privacy minimization principles.

attribution.title: Important: Verification Scope vs Platform Attribution
attribution.subtitle: This app's verification focuses on event triggering and data quality, and does not guarantee consistency with platform-side attribution.
attribution.provideContent: Pixel event trigger records, parameter completeness, order amount/currency consistency evidence.
attribution.noGuaranteeContent: That attribution data in platform reports matches Shopify order data exactly. Platform attribution is affected by multiple factors including platform algorithms, user privacy settings, cross-device tracking restrictions, and platform data deduplication/merging rules.
attribution.reportContent: If verification shows 'Passed', it means pixel events are normal in this app's reception and validation link; platform-side attribution may still show discrepancies, which is normal.
attribution.methodContent: You can view event triggering and data quality via this app's verification report, or use platform-provided tools to verify event reception.

upgradeBanner.content3: This is the core deliverable of the project, suitable for Agencies to report acceptance to clients.
